text: Hello! I’ve got a question about workflows or maybe this isn’t something that’s even suitable for workflows. I would like every ticket to have certain properties copied to it from the contact it was created from. I have made some rudimentary ones in the UI but they seem to only trigger once so if I change a property in the contact it won’t reflect this in the ticket unless I manually re-enroll the contact. Is there a better way of doing this?

what is the trigger? I think if the trigger is that the contact property “is known,” then in re-enrollment you can check the field on and it will re-enroll when that’s changed. will want to test that that’s true!
It’s exactly that, however it seems if the field is empty originally and I change it later it won’t re-enroll

I would recommend looking at moving your ticket management under Inbox, this would allow you to see the right sidebar for the contact where you can include and update the contact properties directly, see company, deals, etc. as well as other tickets.

Using conversations for tickets makes it a lot easier to have a holistic view of the contact for your service team and avoids having to copy properties

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/tickets/manage-the-tickets-in-your-inbox>
Interesting, we moved away from this method as it got too messy. Is there a way to create an inbox for each agent?
When Inbox first came out, you could assign users by channel, the source for where the conversations are coming from, but I think with the advanced filters now it is more manageable
We just use the "assigned to me" view and allow the ticket automation to assign the tickets
<@U04672TBDEX> dumb question, but do you have the specific property trigger checked off?
(I did marital status to test since no one has a value there)
It is off yes
Unless the property is cleared out before it is updated, I don't think that would work to fix the issue since the status will remain known as it changes from one value to another
<@U03AKL6Q1B2> Can I see notes in the inbox? Or I guess you’d use internal comments in place
ok if you check it on then it will re-enroll when that property is updated
Yes, inbox has it's own comments, which makes it much easier to communicate internally than notes
the comments show in the conversation thread, similar to the way they would in the timeline
<@U03MJJ5Q4AG> thanks I will give this a go for now.
Thank you both very much for the advice!
sure thing!
no problem, best of luck!
